definition:
Let $R$ be a unital ring. A finitely generated projective right
$R$-module is of the form $eR^n$, $n \in {\mathbb{N}}$, where $e$ is an
idempotent in ${\mathop{\mathrm{End}}\nolimits}_R(R^n)$.

Let $A$ be a unital $C^*$-algebra and $p$ be a projection in
${\mathop{\mathrm{End}}\nolimits}_A(A^n)$, $n \in {\mathbb{N}}$. Then,
${\mathord{\mathcal{E}}}= pA^n$ is a finitely generated projective right
$A$-module. Further, ${\mathord{\mathcal{E}}}$ is a pre-Hilbert
$A$-module with ($A$-valued) inner product
$$\langle u,v \rangle = \sum_{i=1}^n u_i^* v_i, \quad u,v \in {\mathord{\mathcal{E}}}.$$
